page.title: 07Gold Strike
page.content:
Pulloxhill Gold Strike of 1680
This little village might have been a much more important place had not the discovery of gold in 1860 been no more than a literal flash in the pan. As all the gold found in the United Kingdom is the property of the Crown, Charles 11 immediately siezed the site and it was leased to a firm of refiners. However the gold was no more than a few flakes, insufficient to cover refining costs and was soon abandoned, remembered today only in the local field name of Gold Close.
